# start()

**Instance Method**

Attempts to start the query.

## Declaration

```swift
func start() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when successful; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

A query may fail to start if it does not specify a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMetadataQuery/predicate], or if the query has already been started.

## Discussion

A query can’t be started if the receiver is already running a query or no predicate has been specified.

This method must be called from the receiver’s [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMetadataQuery/operationQueue] or on the main thread. For example:



## Running Queries

- **isStarted**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the query has started. (read-only)
- **isGathering**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is in the initial gathering phase of the query. (read-only)
- **isStopped**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the query has stopped.
- **stop()**: Stops the receiver’s current query from gathering any further results.
